Penance.synopsis: This occurs as Abdirak is beating the player. Breathless with excitement. Reveling in the act of penance - think preacher in 'god will save us, save us ALL!' mode as he, well, beats the crap out of the player. All of his reactions should be manic, joyous and vaguely sexual. Player is in front of him, facing a wall as he raises his weapon and beats the player. The weapon will be either a dagger, handaxe or a scourge.
Penance.how_to_trigger: Talk to Abdirak, accept to do his penance and follow his instructions. This plays after he hit you. Make sure to have enough HP; this is not played at level 1 normally.

PostPenance.synopsis: |Abdirak fully completed his penance with a player. It can't be tried again.|

RewardPenance.synopsis:
Father Abdirak is a follower of Loviatar, a goddess that thrives on inflicting pain on others. He is indulging in some private 'worship' (self flagellation). He offers to help alleviate the player's pain by giving them 'penance' - i.e, beating them. 
Loviatar = loh-VEE-a-tar. He is a young and charismatic preacher with a threatening and creepy edge.
RewardPenance.how_to_trigger: oe debugbook > Go to region > GOB > To Abdirak the Pain Priestgod onroll amazingtrigger penance dialog and do not chose to leavedialog will automatically trigger after 3 hits

DuringPenance.synopsis:
Father Abdirak is a follower of Loviatar, a goddess that thrives on inflicting pain on others. He is indulging in some private 'worship' (self flagellation). He offers to help alleviate the player's pain by giving them 'penance' - i.e, beating them. 
Loviatar = loh-VEE-a-tar. He is a young and charismatic preacher with a threatening and creepy edge.
DuringPenance.how_to_trigger: To trigger:goto 338.066; 40.842; -21.781SetCharacterOsirisFlag GOB_PainPriest_State_Penitent on main characterAdd any Companion

Battlestation.synopsis: The goblins are fighting. He's going to leave, He loves pain - not death.

individual_metadata.synopsis:
Father Abdirak is a follower of Loviatar, a goddess that thrives on inflicting pain on others. He is indulging in some private 'worship' (self flagellation). He offers to help alleviate the player's pain by giving them 'penance' - i.e, beating them. 
Loviatar = loh-VEE-a-tar. He is a young and charismatic preacher with a threatening edge.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: goto 334, -22Make sure you have enough health and level or the interaction will be cut short by health depleting

automatic_ordering.reasoning: The data shows that there is a clear sequence in the penance storyline: first, the initial scene 'Penance' occurs when Abdirak starts beating the player. Once this scene has taken place, the later scene 'PostPenance' is reached to indicate that the penance has been completed and cannot be repeated. In addition, there are three sessions—'RewardPenance', 'DuringPenance', and the session with an empty string as its key—that all share very similar descriptions and details about Abdirak’s painful, flagellation-style approach. Their similar synopses and different trigger methods suggest that they are alternative ways to experience essentially the same event rather than distinct parts of a single linear narrative. Thus if one of these is triggered in a playthrough, the others would not be encountered, making them mutually exclusive.

Penance_9.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_9.text: You are doing so well - do not give in now!
Penance_9.context: InternalNodeContext: Player gave only good answers so far!NodeContext: Player has called out again for mercy. More encouraging now in his mania (but still uber passionate and creepy)

Penance_15.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_15.context: InternalNodeContext: Previous answer was positive, but the first one was bad, so the player won't get an inspiration point anyway

Penance_25.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_25.text: Offer your pain to Loviatar - and you shall be rewarded.
Penance_25.context: InternalNodeContext: If there's a bug in the flag set or something, more than 3 hits, etc. this node will back us upNodeContext: Gearing up to strike the player. Tense with excitement and joy.

Penance_28.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_28.text: That's it! Welcome the pain. Let it become part of you!
Penance_28.context: InternalNodeContext: Player gave only good answers so far!NodeContext: Breathless, manic as he hits the player as hard as he can as the player encourages him to hit even harder. Passionate, manic, breatheless, sexual

Penance_35.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Excited, weapon in hand. Pause between strikes. InternalNodeContext: Previous answer was a wrong oneNodeContext: Player has braced themselves for the third time. Yelling passionately with excitement.

Penance_27.speaker: Player
Penance_27.text: Grit your teeth and keep still.

Penance_71.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_71.text: So stoic, dear one. A pity.

Penance_65.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_65.text: You whimper so softly - so sweetly!

Penance_124.speaker: Player
Penance_124.text: Ah, mercy! I can't take it... it's too much!

Penance_48.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_48.text: Yes you can, child. Take the pain and offer it up to Loviatar. Offer it all!

Penance_83.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_83.text: Such mockery only harms you, child.

Penance_39.speaker: Player
Penance_39.text: Hit me as hard as you can - or I'll return the favour.

Penance_46.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_46.text: Hah! I hope that's a promise, dear one.

Penance_16.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_16.text: Heh. Do not tease what you will not deliver, dear one.

Penance_26.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_26.text: Yes, my child! More for Loviatar! MORE!

Penance_22.speaker: Player
Penance_22.text: Let the world recede. You neither hear the priest nor feel the blow.
Penance_22.context: InternalNodeContext: The tag is checked on the first option - if this show up, then the player is MONK

Penance_67.speaker: Player
Penance_67.text: Sing out in pain and pleasure. You've never felt so ALIVE.
Penance_67.context: InternalNodeContext: The tag is checked on the first option - if this show up, then the player is BARD

Penance_79.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_79.text: Let the sting of flesh wash away your pain!

Penance_36.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_36.text: The pain you suffer will cleanse you - do not fight it.
Penance_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Weapon in hand (it will be either a dagger, a scourge, or a handaxe). Perhaps by his side as he takes a breathe between strikes to speak to the player. NodeContext: First time stirking the player. Excited and joyous - think a preacher building up to a full 'the lord will save us' act in a church.

Penance_38.speaker: Player
Penance_38.text: Try to hold back your cries.
Penance_38.context: InternalNodeContext: Failing this one is the "positive" outcome because the player reacts to the pain

Penance_110.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_110.text: Do not keep quiet, dear one. Let me hear you.

Penance_61.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_61.text: I heard you, dear one. Whimper, cry, beg - let it all out!

Penance_105.speaker: Player
Penance_105.text: Yelp loudly and dramatically beg for mercy.
Penance_105.context: InternalNodeContext: Succeeding this one is the "positive" outcome because of the reaction to the pain

Penance_114.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_114.text: Your voice sounds so sweet, dear one. Keep going!

Penance_18.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_18.text: Tch. Beg sincerely or don't beg at all!

Penance_89.speaker: Shadowheart
Penance_89.text: Would you have joined up with them if you'd known they'd be indulging in this sort of thing, Astarion?
Penance_89.context: NodeContext: Wry. Observing the player engaging in a ritual involving them being whipped.

Penance_21.speaker: Astarion
Penance_21.text: I mean, I had my hopes.
Penance_21.context: NodeContext: response to 'would you have joined up with them if you knew they were into being whipped?'

Penance_68.speaker: Shadowheart
Penance_68.text: Don't wear them out entirely, priest. I might have use for them yet.
Penance_68.context: NodeContext: Tongue in cheek. Spoken to the pain priest administering the ritual

Penance_24.speaker: Astarion
Penance_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: ClappingNodeContext: Clapping, thrilled to see your companion take a lash from a whip

Penance_116.context: InternalNodeContext: No reaction, either because the reactions already played, or because Shadowheart and/or Astarion couldn't be included

Penance_69.speaker: Player
Penance_69.text: Come on. A child can hit harder than that.
Penance_69.context: InternalNodeContext: Succeeding this one is the "positive" outcome because it challenges the priest and boosts his enthousiasm

Penance_41.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_41.text: Hah! You want more? As you wish, dear one.

Penance_62.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_62.text: You claim to want more, but I feel you flinching, dear one.

Penance_51.speaker: Player
Penance_51.text: Slow your breathing to attain silence, inside and out.

Penance_77.speaker: Player
Penance_77.text: Make a show of screaming at the top of your lungs.

Penance_101.speaker: Player
Penance_101.context: InternalNodeContext: When the event flag CancelPenance is set, Osiris takes care of clearing more flags and resetting the penance

Penance_50.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Excited, weapon in hand. Pause between strikes. NodeContext: Manic and joyous as he continues to strike the player.

Penance_74.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_74.text: Do not keep quiet, dear child. Embrace it!
Penance_74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Excited, weapon in hand. Pause between strikes. NodeContext: Second time striking the player. More manic and joyous as he gets into it.

Penance_12.speaker: Player
Penance_12.text: Take a deep breath and close your eyes.

Penance_108.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_108.text: Come now, child. Do not hold it in!

Penance_118.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_118.text: Is that a moan I hear? Delightful.

Penance_0.speaker: Player
Penance_0.text: Writhe in exaggerated agony and cry out.
Penance_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Succeeding this one is the "positive" outcome because of the reaction to the pain

Penance_29.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_29.text: That's it, dear one! Let Loviatar hear you!

Penance_80.speaker: Astarion
Penance_80.text: My my. Who knew our friend had so much blood in them?
Penance_80.context: NodeContext: To Shadowheart. You're both standing there, casually watching your friend being whipped.

Penance_72.speaker: Shadowheart
Penance_72.text: Try not to lick your lips as you say that.

Penance_91.speaker: Shadowheart
Penance_91.text: Better not let too much be spilled. As much as I'm enjoying the show, we may still need them afterwards.

Penance_73.speaker: Shadowheart
Penance_73.text: Not the worst technique, priest. Good wrist movement, lots of enthusiasm...
Penance_73.context: NodeContext: Tongue in cheek. Complimenting the pain priest on how he's whipping the player.

Penance_11.speaker: Astarion
Penance_11.text: It was a fine strike. Excellent form!
Penance_11.context: NodeContext: Calling out - as if cheering on the priest.

Penance_107.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_107.text: Come now, child. You can do better than that.

Penance_88.speaker: Player
Penance_88.text: You look tired. Should I take over?
Penance_88.context: InternalNodeContext: Succeeding this one is the "positive" outcome because it challenges the priest and boosts his enthousiasm

Penance_54.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_54.text: Heh. You are shaking, dear one. And now is not the time for a brave face.

Penance_55.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_55.text: Hah! Wonderful. You want more? I'll give it to you.

Penance_117.speaker: Player
Penance_117.text: Slow your heart and sink deeper into the stillness.
Penance_117.context: InternalNodeContext: The tag is checked on the first option - if this show up, then the player is MONK

Penance_43.speaker: Player

Penance_43.context: InternalNodeContext: The tag is checked on the first option - if this show up, then the player is BARD

Penance_84.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_84.text: Pain is proof that we live! Revel in it.
Penance_84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Excited, weapon in hand. Pause between strikes. NodeContext: Player has called out for mercy. He has refused. Full preacher mode as he continues to strike the player. Awe and excitement in his voice.

Penance_90.speaker: Abdirak
Penance_90.text: Do not mock the gifts you receive!
Penance_90.context: InternalNodeContext: Previous answer was a wrong one

PostPenance_3.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance_3.text: Excuse me - I must rest and think.

PostPenance_4.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance_4.text: A most invigorating session - but even as the soul sings, the flesh fades.
PostPenance_4.context: InternalNodeContext: After a player completed the penance. Priest could be alone or doing the penance with goblet

PostPenance_10.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance_10.text: So it is with the Lady's embrace. Excuse me - I must rest and think.

PostPenance_6.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance_6.context: NodeContext: Player has finished penance. Speaking to player as if speaking to a loved one.

PostPenance_8.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance_8.text: You have already enjoyed my ministrations - do not be greedy.
PostPenance_8.context: NodeContext: Gently chiding, as if to a child.

PostPenance_1.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance_1.text: Loviatar herself found your performance inspiring and wishes to bless you.
PostPenance_1.context: NodeContext: Voice intimate and filled with admiration. His goddess has chosen to bless the player - a sacred gift.

PostPenance_7.speaker: Player
PostPenance_7.text: What would such a blessing entail?

PostPenance_5.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance_5.context: NodeContext: As if speaking to a lover.

PostPenance_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: This can be anything - for reaching a hand out and gently passing it over the player to holding both hands out and closing his eyes in concentration as he passes on the blessing. As long as it is something that indicates that a spell/blessing is happening, it can be anything. NodeContext: Not voiced

PostPenance_0.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance_0.text: And on a personal note, thank you. That was positively divine.
PostPenance_0.context: NodeContext: This is a low, sultry. Almost whispered in the player's ear. Sexy and intimate. But also creepy as all hell.

RewardPenance_4.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance_4.text: Sweet child. While I enjoyed that, I'm afraid your reaction was... lacking.
RewardPenance_4.context: NodeContext: Voice low and intimate. Player did penance but did not react correctly. He regrets that the player does not get a reward (but he had a great time, which is all he really cares abotu)

RewardPenance_8.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance_8.text: To gain Loviatar's favour, every single strike should be met with an honest cry of pain - or perhaps a touch of begging.

RewardPenance_16.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance_16.text: Nevertheless, thank you. And I pray you've learned from today's little... lesson.

RewardPenance_19.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance_19.text: Sweet child, you bore the pain like a true believer.
RewardPenance_19.context: InternalNodeContext: BadReaction isn't set, therefore all reactions were good!NodeContext: Penance is finished. He's a little breathless after beating the player near senseless. Voice is low and intimate.

RewardPenance_5.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance_5.text: I could feel Loviatar's pleasure with every sting of my scourge.

RewardPenance_17.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance_17.text: I could feel Loviatar's pleasure with every slice of my dagger.

RewardPenance_3.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance_3.text: I could feel Loviatar's pleasure with every swing of my axe.

RewardPenance_6.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance_6.text: I am proud to have served you this penance.
RewardPenance_6.context: NodeContext: Got his breath back a little. Voice is low and intimate.

RewardPenance_7.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance_7.context: NodeContext: voice low and intimate, as if speaking to a lover.

RewardPenance_12.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance_12.text: Interesting is an understatement, dear one.
RewardPenance_12.context: NodeContext: voice low and intimate, as if speaking to a lover.

RewardPenance_18.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance_18.text: I know, dear one. That was my favourite part.
RewardPenance_18.context: NodeContext: Player has told him that they had begged for mercy during the penance. Smile on Abdirak's face as he recalls that moment.

RewardPenance_13.speaker: Player
RewardPenance_13.text: You could have hit me much harder.

RewardPenance_10.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance_10.text: You're starting to sound like the goddess herself, dear one.
RewardPenance_10.context: NodeContext: Voice intimate and filled with admiration.

RewardPenance_1.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance_1.context: NodeContext: Voice intimate and filled with admiration.

RewardPenance_11.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance_11.text: Loviatar herself found your performance... inspiring. She has deemed you worthy of her blessing.
RewardPenance_11.context: NodeContext: Voice intimate and filled with admiration. His goddess has chosen to bless the player - a sacred gift.

RewardPenance_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: This can be anything - for reaching a hand out and gently passing it over the player to holding both hands out and closing his eyes in concentration as he passes on the blessing. As long as it is something that indicates that a spell/blessing is happening, it can be anything. NodeContext: Not voiced

RewardPenance_15.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance_15.text: And on a personal note, thank you. That was positively divine.
RewardPenance_15.context: NodeContext: This is a low, sultry. Almost whispered in the player's ear. Sexy and intimate. But also creepy as all hell.

DuringPenance_0.speaker: Abdirak
DuringPenance_0.text: Come now, dear child. It is time to repent.
DuringPenance_0.context: NodeContext: Penance was interrupted. Player has returned to speak to Abdirak. Voice low and inviting as he wishes to continue the beating.

DuringPenance_8.speaker: Player
DuringPenance_8.text: Hurry up and hit me already.
DuringPenance_8.context: InternalNodeContext: The player was hit at least once by the priest during the penance

DuringPenance_4.speaker: Abdirak
DuringPenance_4.text: And there is more to come, but I promise it shall be worth it. Now, face the wall - and stay absolutely still.
DuringPenance_4.context: NodeContext: Authorative tone but also a warning. He wants to hurt the player but not badly, and not outside of his realm of control. Safety first!

DuringPenance_1.speaker: Player
DuringPenance_1.text: What do you want me to do?
DuringPenance_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The penance didn't really start yet, the player wasn't hit yet.

DuringPenance_5.speaker: Abdirak
DuringPenance_5.text: Simply face that wall - and stay absolutely still.
DuringPenance_5.context: NodeContext: Authorative tone but also a warning. He wants to hurt the player but not badly, and not outside of his realm of control. Safety first!

DuringPenance_2.speaker: Abdirak
DuringPenance_2.text: A pity. We would have such fun together.
DuringPenance_2.context: NodeContext: Sigh and a shrug at the player's refusal of his penance. But a smile and a wink as he says the player can always return to him.

DuringPenance_3.speaker: Abdirak
DuringPenance_3.text: Now, now - I'm dealing with your friend. I'll be just a moment.
DuringPenance_3.context: NodeContext: Another player has tried to 'interrupt' the penance. Smile in his face. Intimate.

DuringPenance_7.speaker: Abdirak
DuringPenance_7.text: I'm afraid someone took your place, dear one.
DuringPenance_7.context: InternalNodeContext: The speaker player character tried to accept the penance, but was too low HP. Another PC came along with enough HP and started the penance, so the PC that was too low HP lost their spot

Battlestation_0.speaker: Abdirak
Battlestation_0.text: My penitent child, the goblins have blood on their minds. I am leaving - I suggest you do the same.
Battlestation_0.context: NodeContext: The goblins are fighting, he's calm and measured but about to flee. He wants no part in it.

Battlestation_1.speaker: Abdirak
Battlestation_1.text: These goblins have blood on their minds. I am leaving - I suggest you do the same.
Battlestation_1.context: NodeContext: The goblins are fighting, he's calm and measured but about to flee. He wants no part in it.

Battlestation_2.speaker: Abdirak
Battlestation_2.text: I fear we must abandon your penance. These goblins have death on their minds. I am leaving - I suggest you do the same.
Battlestation_2.context: NodeContext: The goblins are fighting, he's calm and measured but about to flee. He wants no part in it.

Battlestation_3.speaker: Abdirak
Battlestation_3.text: Dear child, the goblins have blood on their minds. I am leaving - I suggest you do the same.
Battlestation_3.context: NodeContext: The goblins are fighting, he's calm and measured but about to flee. He wants no part in it.

9.speaker: Abdirak
9.text: Greetings, child. I fear your companion could not fully embrace my penance.
9.context: InternalNodeContext: This flag is set when the priest hits the player during the penance. So this greeting is handling an edge-case: player starts the penance, get hits one or more, cancels the penance before the end, and then talk to the priest with another character. Keep it simple

84.speaker: Abdirak
84.text: But I understand. Pain is something that requires commitment, wouldn't you say?

52.speaker: Abdirak
52.text: Most excellent! Then I shall speak plainly.

158.speaker: Abdirak
158.text: Would you care experience it first-hand? To know peace and serenity, the likes of which few experience?

34.speaker: Abdirak
34.text: Exactly. And should your friend lack such qualities, that is not their fault.

31.speaker: Abdirak
31.text: I pity them. They've missed out on the true intimacies of pain...

97.speaker: Abdirak
97.text: True. But isn't that why it's important to try it? To expand your horizons?

60.speaker: Abdirak
60.text: To understand pain and its intimacies...

15.speaker: Abdirak
15.text: I see you are whole once again. Tell me, child - would you care to begin?
15.context: NodeContext: Player has been healed and is ready to begin penance. Eyes light up - he is excited and looking forward to the beating.

16.speaker: Abdirak
16.text: Well met, dear child. Would you enjoy some hands-on worship of Loviatar, Maiden of Pain?
16.context: NodeContext: Player has met Abdirak but not done the penance. Voice low and inviting and familiar.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: I saw your book. I'd like to try some of those techniques.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: I think I can do without.

148.speaker: Abdirak
148.text: Pity. You do not understand the gift you refuse.
148.context: NodeContext: Sigh and a shrug at the player's refusal of his penance.

75.speaker: Abdirak
75.text: Greetings, child. I've met few aside from goblins here.
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: He has paused in beating himself to stand and greet the player. NodeContext: Player is one of the few non-goblins he's met in this place. Welcomes another for conversation and discussion but there should be something vaguely threatening about him. Charismatic, sexy, and creepy all in one.

133.speaker: Player
133.context: InternalNodeContext: A player with the CLERIC or PALADIN tag will have this flag set alreay before starting the dialog, so they bypass the passive check

177.speaker: Narrator
177.text: *You recognise the scourge - this man is a follower of Loviatar, goddess of pain.*

153.speaker: Abdirak
153.text: Ah, are you also here to assist with the prisoner?

112.speaker: Player
112.text: I showed them what a master can do.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: I talked with the torturers. Amateurs.

109.speaker: Abdirak
109.text: Quite right. I was invited to teach them. I live for pain and its intricacies, you see.
109.context: NodeContext: Discusses eyes light up at the mention of pain but discussing it in an academic sense

63.speaker: Abdirak
63.text: But alas, they insist on being so primitive.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: You mean the one they are torturing?

22.speaker: Abdirak
22.text: Please. The things they are doing to that man... so crude and primitive.
22.context: NodeContext: Distates. Like an expert in wine being present with a bottle from Tesco. He loves pain, he just has an issue with the lack of artistery.

92.speaker: Abdirak
92.text: I was invited to to teach them. I live for pain and its intricacies, you see, but alas...
92.context: NodeContext: Discusses eyes light up at the mention of pain but discussing it in an academic sense

32.speaker: Abdirak
32.text: I was invited to teach them some of my... techniques. I live for pain and its intricacies, you see.
32.context: NodeContext: Discusses eyes light up at the mention of pain but discussing it in an academic sense

48.speaker: Abdirak
48.text: But alas, these goblins seem to thrive on the crude and primitive.

178.speaker: Abdirak
178.text: Your tastes must turn to the exotic, if you would stop here by choice.

85.speaker: Abdirak
85.text: I was invited to discuss pain and its intricacies, but even I find these goblins crude and, well - primitive.
85.context: NodeContext: Distates. Like an expert in wine being present with a bottle from Tesco. He loves pain, he just has an issue with the lack of artistery.

150.speaker: Abdirak
150.text: The gentleman being held next door. My acquaintance is working on him, I believe.

19.speaker: Abdirak
19.text: While I was thrilled to be invited here, I must confess I find the goblins and their methods... crude and primitive.

188.speaker: Abdirak
188.text: Pain without purpose is a terrible thing, wouldn't you agree?
188.context: NodeContext: No horror in his voice. Discussing it like an intellectual pursuit. It is not the violence he takes issue with, it is the fact that they do it simply for fun.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: As long as the story ends in death, it's all the same to me.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: I often feel I like raw pain too much. It scares me.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: As Vlaakith says: we cannot know pleasure without pain.

78.speaker: Abdirak
78.text: Exactly, pain is an intimate thing. It should be delivered with a loving and measured hand.
78.context: NodeContext: Eyes light up as he discusses pain and his approach to it. This is clearly something he is passionate about and believes in.

113.speaker: Abdirak
113.text: But trying to discuss such subtleties with these creatures is simply...
113.context: NodeContext: Slightly irritated, the goblins have fobbed him off and he's been left to his own painful devices.

70.speaker: Abdirak
70.text: Yes. He's just over there. Between you and I, his claims of mastery over pain are unfounded.
70.context: InternalNodeContext: Spike is in the same room as the Pain PriestNodeContext: Player has asked who invited him here. It was a goblin who is torturing someone next door. His tone is dismissive. He believes the goblin doesn't know what he's doing.

154.speaker: Abdirak
154.text: Pain should be intimate and loving - not violent and brutish. Alas, he...
154.context: InternalNodeContext: Spike is alive, so the Pain Priest can be a bit more subtle when talking about him; just for flavour, Spike doesn't really hear the dialog

179.speaker: Abdirak
179.text: Or claimed, rather. Pain should be intimate and loving - not violent and brutish. Perhaps in death he...

123.speaker: Abdirak
123.text: Yes. One who claims to be a master of pain. Tch.
123.context: NodeContext: Player has asked who invited him here. It was a goblin who is torturing someone next door. His tone is dismissive. He believes the goblin doesn't know what he's doing.

36.speaker: Abdirak
36.text: Pain is intimate and loving. But trying to discuss that with these creatures...
36.context: NodeContext: Irritated in the opening line, but then his eyes light up and he smiles as he discusses PAIN. It is his life's passion and something he is enthusiastic about.

49.speaker: Abdirak
49.text: Forgive me, but that look in your eyes - something terrible has happened to you.
49.context: NodeContext: He's looking the player in the eyes and is concerned - he can see the player has been hurt (emotionally) and is worried. This is sincere.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: I feel an endless nausea, that only goes away when I'm killing.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I'm trying to resist my drive to do harm, but it's very difficult.

45.speaker: Abdirak
45.text: Do not be ashamed, child. What I see in your eyes, in your soul, is only natural.
45.context: NodeContext: Player has told him to bugger off, basically. Abdirak assumes the player is embarassed, he is sincere - he has seen pain in the player's eyes and wishes to comfort him.

142.speaker: Abdirak
142.text: We've all suffered in these dark times. It is little wonder you bear scars of pain and anguish.
142.context: NodeContext: He is trying to comfort and connect with the player.

86.speaker: Abdirak
86.text: Please let me alleviate this pain.
86.context: NodeContext: hesitates on the word 'alleiviate'. He believes that the beating he is about to offer will genuinely help. Sincere. Said with a smile.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: And how would you do that?

186.speaker: Abdirak
186.text: As the Maiden of Pain, the goddess Loviatar, teaches us...
186.context: NodeContext: Player has asked about the 'penance' Abdirak has suggested. Explaining about his goddes Loviatar. Sincere. Believes pain is a beautiful thing. Voice more sexy than creepy.

28.speaker: Abdirak
28.text: ...through penance - administered by my skilled hand.

143.speaker: Abdirak
143.text: My work can grant peace and serenity - the likes of which few experience. It will be worth it - I promise.

176.context:
CinematicNodeContext: He gestures to the table, where a selection of weapons lays ready. The priest should look very sincere in this scene. He genuinely 
thinks he's helping you.

67.speaker: Lae'zel
67.text: By all means - let us see what his 'skilled hand' might get up to.

80.speaker: Shadowheart
80.text: Go ahead - I'm sure you're in need of a little penance...
80.context: NodeContext: Sly smirk. Ribbing the player into engaging in the pain priest's S&M-style ritual.

47.speaker: Karlach
47.text: Hahaha. Go on. I have to see this.

62.speaker: Abdirak
62.text: Oh, I have something exquisite in mind.
62.context: NodeContext: Player has agreed to the beating/penance. Excited. Sexually charged. Already imaging the pain he is about to inflict.

173.speaker: Abdirak
173.text: Both Loviatar and I are interested in how you handle pain, dear one.
173.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gestures to the wall. NodeContext: Authorative tone but also a warning. He wants to hurt the player but not badly, and not outside of his realm of control. Safety first!

185.speaker: Abdirak
185.text: And should you delight her, you will most assuredly receive her gracious blessing - trust me.

23.speaker: Abdirak
23.text: Simply face the wall, and we can begin.
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gestures to the wall. NodeContext: Authorative tone but also a warning. He wants to hurt the player but not badly, and not outside of his realm of control. Safety first!

88.speaker: Abdirak
88.text: But wait - you are hurt. Please tend to your wounds before we begin your penance.
88.context: NodeContext: Player has agreed to do penance but their health is too low. The priest is warning that they must heal first. Genuine and sincere, he doesn't want to hurt them.

105.speaker: Abdirak
105.context: NodeContext: A smile as he says this - vaguely sexual overtones.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Touch me and you'll lose your hand.

140.speaker: Abdirak
140.context: NodeContext: Player has threatened him with physical violence. He is delighted. Almost winks as he says this.

25.speaker: Abdirak
25.text: A pity though. You would know such sweet relief at my hands.
25.context: NodeContext: sighs at the player's rejections. Sounds charismatic and sensual as he thinks of the beating he would have inflicted on the player.

81.speaker: Abdirak
81.text: Now, if you'll excuse me, I should return to my own worship.
81.context: NodeContext: plans to return to self flagellation. Looking forward to it.

121.speaker: Abdirak
121.text: I thought you would prove interesting... I guess I was mistaken.
121.context: NodeContext: Sighs. Player has left the conversation without doing any penance. Intimate note to his voice as he thinks of the pain he would have inflicted.

156.speaker: Astarion
156.text: I must see this. Don't you dare say no.
156.context: NodeContext: Excited to see your companion beaten bloody by a flaggellant priest.

69.speaker: Wyll
69.text: I wouldn't let his 'skilled hand' anywhere near me.

90.speaker: Gale
90.text: Your hide, your choice. Not quite my cup of tea though.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I know of your penance - my companion has tried it.

5.speaker: Abdirak
5.text: Well, perhaps you'd be interested in finishing what they started?

152.speaker: Abdirak
152.text: Well - the Maiden of Pain, Loviatar, teaches us that pain is a most powerful and sacred sensation.
152.context: NodeContext: Explaining about his goddes Loviatar. Sincere. Believes pain is a beautiful thing. Voice more sexy than creepy.

99.speaker: Abdirak
99.text: And should our pain delight her - should we embrace such a gift - she will grant her most sacred of blessings.

145.speaker: Abdirak
145.text: If you would permit it, I can show you first-hand.

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *This man is of common stock. Only the poorest of men need settle for the spectacle of their own gore.*

102.speaker: Abdirak
102.text: Oh, I have something exquisite in mind.
102.context: NodeContext: Player has agreed to the beating/penance. Excited. Sexually charged. Already imaging the pain he is about to inflict.

64.speaker: Abdirak
64.text: A pity. You would know such sweet relief at my hands.
64.context: NodeContext: Sighs. Player has left the conversation without doing any penance. Intimate note to his voice as he thinks of the pain he would have inflicted.

65.speaker: Abdirak
65.text: Should you realise you need my assistance, come back. I'll be waiting.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Clever man. How did you know?

138.speaker: Abdirak
138.text: Because I see those same eyes when I look in the mirror, dear one.
138.context: NodeContext: Player has asked how he knew something terrible had happened them. Abdirak sadly replies. He is think of his own traumatic past, which ultimately led him to turn to Loviatar as a way coping with the trauma.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Then why are you beating yourself?

107.speaker: Abdirak
107.text: Hah. I realise this looks strange, but I assure you, it is a most intimate form of worship.
107.context: NodeContext: The player has pointed out that he is beating himself bloody. He smiles, his eyes lighting up as he begins to explain. He believes in what he is doing.

55.speaker: Abdirak
55.text: You see, pain is a loving thing. But trying to explain it to these goblins has proven...
55.context: NodeContext: Passionate and enthusiastic as he explains. Pain and its infliction is his pride and joy.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I thought a follower of Loviatar would approve of pain.

106.speaker: Abdirak
106.text: You know the Maiden of Pain? How refreshing. But there is more to us than that.
106.context: NodeContext: Eyes light up as he discusses pain. Considers pain and its intimacies a form of therapy and even art, but he knows that not everyone will feel that way about Pain, or his Goddess, Loviatar.

181.speaker: Abdirak
181.text: Yes, we worship her through pain - often our own. But it is an intimate and loving thing and one we offer up.

129.speaker: Abdirak
129.text: If you would permit it, I can show you first-hand.
129.context: NodeContext: He is offering to beat the player with a weapon of choice, This is a sincere and genuine offer, He believes in what he is doing and that it will, ultimately, help the player.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: What's a follower of the Maiden of Pain doing here?

35.speaker: Abdirak
35.text: Ah, you are familiar with the Scourge Mistress? Good. I am simply spreading her message, friend.
35.context: NodeContext: A smile. The player has realised that he worships an evil goddess. He knows he is likely not going to win this argument on the merits of pain and torture, but he is sincere as he explain how he worships his goddess.

183.speaker: Abdirak
183.text: I worship her through pain - usually my own. But I have a skilled hand when it comes to its infliction.

43.speaker: Abdirak
43.text: Care to expand your horizons? It will be worth it - you have my word.
43.context: NodeContext: A smile as he offers to, basically, beat the player. It is a sincere and genuine offer, he believes it will help.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: I saw your book. Let me try some of those techniques.

132.speaker: Abdirak
132.text: My - an eager student indeed. Those are advanced devotions.

119.speaker: Abdirak
119.text: The Mistress would approve. Indicate which instrument calls to you, and let us put it to work.

4.speaker: Abdirak
4.text: Oh, I do believe we are both going to enjoy this.
4.context: NodeContext: Player has agreed to have the scourge used on him. Abdirak is delighted. Vaguely sexual overtones.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: I'm not in a gentle mood. Use the dagger.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Take the handaxe and show me your worst.

108.speaker: Abdirak
108.context: NodeContext: Player has pointed at another additional weapon. Excited and delighted at the thought of using them on the player. Vaguely sexual overtones.

146.speaker: Player
146.text: I've no interest in the teachings of such an evil goddess.

182.speaker: Abdirak
182.text: Pain is pain, dear one. It is above 'good' and 'evil'.
182.context: NodeContext: Player has told him that his goddess is evil and that he wants to part in this practice. His argument about pain is sincere, he sees it as neither good nor evil, simply as proof that we are alive - and that is worth worshipping and experiencing.

2.speaker: Abdirak
2.text: But very well. You are clearly too closed-minded for the ways of Loviatar.
2.context: NodeContext: A sigh as he dismisses the player and their close-mindedness.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: No - Shar has already claimed me.

73.speaker: Abdirak
73.text: A shame - the Mistress of the Night and the Maiden of Pain could have such fun together.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: No - I already belong to another.

137.speaker: Abdirak
137.text: Unfortunate. Loviatar is always happy to share her pleasures.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: You know the value of suffering. Prepare for the coming pain.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: My god is a possessive one - I better refrain.

103.speaker: Abdirak
103.text: Dear child, tell me: would you like to continue your worship of Loviatar, Maiden of Pain?
103.context: NodeContext: Player started the penance and then cancelled it. Voice low, sexual as he invites them to finish what they started together.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: I think I can do without.

130.speaker: Abdirak
130.text: Pity. You do not understand the gift you refuse.
130.context: NodeContext: Sigh and a shrug at the player's refusal of his penance.

139.speaker: Abdirak
139.text: Dear child, I told you - take care of those wounds, and we will begin your penance.
139.context: NodeContext: Player has tried to come to him for penance but is still wounded. Tone gently chiding, as if speaking to a child.

164.speaker: Abdirak
164.text: You have refused the gift of penance, dear one. I will waste no more time asking you.
